entry.title: Parliament lifts immunity for opposition deputies

media:group.media:title: Parliament lifts immunity for opposition deputies
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament has given the green light to prosecute two high-profile opposition figures: former Defense Minister Seyran Ohanyan and current deputy and head of the Hayastan political faction, Artsvik Minasyan. üìç Armenia‚Äôs ex-defense and environment ministers accused of illegal land seizure and abuse of power in a protected national park. üìç Turkish President Recep Tayyip‚ÄØErdoƒüan claims Armenia is showing more flexibility on opening a transport corridor through Syunik.

entry.title: How an NBA coach is transforming Armenian basketball

media:group.media:title: How an NBA coach is transforming Armenian basketball
media:group.media:description:
Rex Kalamian, assistant coach of the Milwaukee Bucks and head coach of Armenia‚Äôs national basketball team, shares how he‚Äôs using his NBA experience to build Armenia‚Äôs basketball program from the ground up. Kalamian offers insights into his recruiting process and what he‚Äôs learned working with some of the biggest names in the game. He also reflects on what representing Armenia means to him as the grandson of a genocide survivor and the profound impact his work in the country has had on him.
0:00- Introduction 0:44- How he became the national team‚Äôs coach 2:08- The Process 4:09- On coaching famous stars and local Armenians 6:33- Attracting top diasporan talent 8:33- What he‚Äôs brought from the NBA to Armenia 10:14- How competitive can the Armenian team be? 11:29- Bringing the players together 12:35- Inspiration from his grandmother 13:54- Advice to kids who want to play 14:42- Supporting the team

entry.title: Parliament passes bill to nationalize Armenia‚Äôs power grid: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Parliament passes bill to nationalize Armenia‚Äôs power grid: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament passed a bill allowing the government to seize control of ENA, the country‚Äôs main power distributor. The family of Samvel Karapetyan, the utility‚Äôs jailed billionaire owner, said they were ready to file a lawsuit disputing any potential seizure. üìç The Zangezur Combine, Armenia‚Äôs largest mine, paid the government more than $29 million in dividends on last year‚Äôs earnings. That takes the government‚Äôs total earnings since it took a minority stake in the enterprise several years ago to nearly $116 million.

media:group.media:title: Armenian parliament targets opposition lawmakers
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament debates lifting immunity for opposition lawmakers Seyran Ohanyan and Artsvik Minasyan over corruption-related charges. üìç Detained businessman Samvel Karapetyan is suing two ruling party lawmakers for defamation over claims linking him to Russia and activity against the state. üìç The Armenian Patriarch of Istanbul explains the Patriarchate‚Äôs closure during Pashinyan‚Äôs visit last month, citing procedural issues and a silent protest over the prime minister‚Äôs criticism of the Catholicos.

entry.title: Can Azerbaijan be prosecuted for war crimes?

media:group.media:title: Can Azerbaijan be prosecuted for war crimes?
media:group.media:description:
Steve Swerdlow, human rights lawyer and professor at the University of Southern California, examines the human rights implications of Azerbaijan‚Äôs 2022 attack on Armenia and the ongoing border aggression. Drawing on international law and his own fieldwork, Swerdlow argues that these actions constitute a crime, and calls for accountability through the International Criminal Court or universal jurisdiction, a legal principle that allows states or international organizations to prosecute individuals. He also highlights the dangers of entrenched hate speech and Armenophobia in Azerbaijan, and makes the case for international pressure, legal action, and a recommitment by Armenia to its human rights obligations as part of its path forward.
0:00- Introduction 0:34- Azerbaijan‚Äôs September 2022 invasion of Armenia 2:41- The crime of aggression 4:29- Azerbaijan will be held to account 5:23- Will Azerbaijan dodge international accountability forever? 8:46- Effects of hatred being inculcated into Azerbaijani society 11:51- Importance of Armenia upholding democratic principles

entry.title: Armenia reaffirms backing for regional transit under its sovereign control

media:group.media:title: Armenia reaffirms backing for regional transit under its sovereign control
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia reaffirms support for unblocking regional transport links under Yerevan‚Äôs sovereignty, responding to reports of a U.S.-backed plan that aligns with the Crossroads of Peace initiative. üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament has passed a law enabling the state to take control of the Electricity Networks of Armenia, despite objections from the country‚Äôs opposition. üìç Armenia expands and simplifies its housing support program to aid displaced families from Nagorno-Karabakh, extending eligibility and deadlines through 2027. üìç Why this is the moment to accelerate Armenia-India ties- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2eIeV6xASFk
